p: In addition, due to its linoleic acid content, evening primrose oil has a beneficial moisturizing effect on the mucous membrane in acne patients treated with isotretinoin [ 34]. This implies that skin supplementation with evening primrose oil improves the skin’s water balance, which is weakened by treatment with isotretinoin. Moreover, γ-linolenic acid, contained in large amounts in the oil, is a source of the anti-inflammatory eicosanoids 15-HETrE and PGE 1, which have anti-proliferative properties that effectively prevent epidermal hyperproliferation [ 24, 34]. In addition, these compounds inhibit the proliferation of smooth muscle cells and prevent the development of atherosclerotic plaque [ 24].
